channel.title: Review on Dr Random
channel.description: Recent content in Review on Dr Random

item.title: Review: Art of Unit Testing by Roy Osherove
item.description: I was pleased to find recently that Roy Osherove’s Art of Unit Testing was available on Safari. I have been following Roy’s blog for a while now, and was quite excited at the prospect of him writing a book on Unit Testing. It was only my personal cheapness that kept me from shelling out the $25 to get the E-Book version from Manning ahead of time. I have to say, now that I have read it, that it would have been well worth the money.

item.title: Review – TypeMock Racer and Unit Testing Multithreaded Applications
item.description: The folks at TypeMock have released a new UnitTesting tool aimed specifically at catching deadlocks in multithreaded code called TypeMock Racer , and what’s more they are offering free licenses to folks willing to review it during the 21 day free trial period. As anyone who knows me can testify to, I am a whore for free-bees, so I decided to take them up on this. For the impatient, here is the executive summary:
